text: City Council passes Lightfoot’s $1.1 billion COVID-19 spending plan over concerns it could help fund police as bid to remove cops from CPS suffers setback
Coronavirus in Illinois updates: 546 new known cases and 87 more deaths reported as bars and brewers in Chicago reopen and Lightfoot’s COVID-19 spending plan passes
In new book, John Bolton describes several episodes where President Trump expresses willingness to ‘give personal favors to dictators he liked'
The traffic is back. Cars and trucks back on city, state roads as more businesses reopen.
Rejoining the world, Chicago? We have a four-star guide for your day as you stumble back into the light
Quaker Oats getting rid of Aunt Jemima, citing ‘racial stereotype.’ Uncle Ben’s and Mrs. Butterworth’s may be next.
How travel might look totally different after coronavirus
Protesting alone: Chicagoan Aiden Kelley, age 9, is among the solo George Floyd demonstrators who are taking a stand
More than 70 black-owned Chicago restaurants celebrate Juneteenth with $6.19 specials
Lakefront mansion in Kenilworth with private beach: $8.75M
After 3 months of pent-up demand, Chicago bars reopen — ‘I’m super excited,’ says Green Lady owner
Editorial: Don’t ban Chicago police from every public school
Column: Talking about social justice reform without affirmative action is just hot air
Column: MLB’s Texas Rangers should give up their name, which honors police force with brutal, racist history
Column: Is baseball nearing a return? All we can do is hope for the best after the latest up-and-down negotiations.
Ask Amy: Spouse considers leaving alcoholic wife
Thousands of Chicago employees will get a day off Friday for Juneteenth in the wake of George Floyd’s death. ‘I don’t think that companies knew until now.’
Two days before a hearing that could have set him free, the courthouse shut down. Now inmates like LaRon Warren wait, as they try to dodge coronavirus.
Will CPS reopen in the fall? Teachers union says students shouldn’t be ‘pushed back’ into schools without ‘proper support to keep them safe’
New quarterbacks coach John DeFilippo sees ‘juice’ as a key ingredient in the Bears’ offensive turnaround: ‘Passion, energy and swagger, baby’
MLB offers a 60-game schedule and full prorated pay in its latest proposal to players
Gov. J.B. Pritzker promotes $900 million federally funded coronavirus relief package
Chicago Cubs President Theo Epstein’s foundation to hold virtual charity concert for the 1st time
What are new Chicago Bears offensive coordinator Bill Lazor’s duties? From evaluating the playbook, running game and QB competition, ‘You’re judged on how it all goes.’

‘That 70s Show’ actor Danny Masterson charged in 3 rapes
Report: Kobe Bryant helicopter pilot may have been disoriented in fog, reported he was climbing when actually descending
Atlanta police officer who fatally shot Rayshard Brooks in the back charged with felony murder
